revised_title: The Direct Agency of the Spermatozoon in the Fecundation of the Ovum in Amphibia
tldr: The author investigates the role of the spermatozoon in the fecundation of the ovum in amphibians, discovering that the spermatozoon penetrates the thick envelopes of the egg and directly communicates with the membrane enclosing the yolk. This finding challenges previous theories that impregnating influence was transmitted through the envelopes and supports the idea that the spermatozoon's influence is direct and immediate.
